Sudden decrease or cessation of logs fro.Data: Windows Event ID 1102, Windows Event ID 7036, Windows Event ID 7045, Zeek conn.log
Sudden decrease or cessation of logs fro.Action: Monitor event logs (e.g., Windows Event Log, security service logs) and log aggregation platforms for sudden drops in log volume or complete cessation of logs from critical security tools (e.g., EDR, AV, Sysmon) or system logging services (e.g., Windows Event Log). Use time series analysis to detect statistically significant anomalies in log rate (e.g., using standard deviation or moving averages).

Unauthorized modifications to Windows Re.Data: Windows Event ID 4657, Windows Event ID 4688
Unauthorized modifications to Windows Re.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4657 for modifications to critical Registry keys associated with security software auto-start, service configuration, or logging settings (e.g., keys under HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services, HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run, HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog). Analyze command-line arguments in Windows Event ID 4688 for suspicious processes attempting to modify these keys or disable services (e.g., `sc stop`, `net stop`, `reg delete`). Correlate modifications with suspicious process activity.
